body_text:
Currently:

Unified Telemetry packets for recipes use the Survey Id and Survey Version fields as is

is a problem because:

this makes success (uptake/usage) by variant impossible to distinguish

Some Solutions

FIX UITour to report a 3rd field.
Change Messaging Recipe to somehow glob the variation into one of those fields, either replacing version (meh) or globbing onto id (meh).  If I were forced to pick, I would say surveyId should be ${surveyId}:${variation}.
Implement Bucketed Sampling with guaranteed non-overlapping samples.  See @Osmose  for details.  In this system, each recipe only has 1 survey, period.
Make Analysts Hope and Pray by doing 2 different recipes, and hope the sampling overlap isn't too much.

title: in telemetry, unable to distinguish survey variants on the same recipe
body:
## Currently:
- Unified Telemetry packets for recipes use the Survey Id and Survey Version fields _as is_

is a problem because:
- this makes success (uptake/usage) by variant impossible to distinguish
## Some Solutions
1.  **FIX UITour** to report a 3rd field.
2. **Change Messaging Recipe** to somehow glob the variation into one of those fields, either replacing version (meh) or globbing onto id (meh).  If I were **forced to pick**, I would say surveyId should be `${surveyId}:${variation}`.
3.  **Implement Bucketed Sampling** with guaranteed non-overlapping samples.  See @Osmose  for details.  In this system, each recipe only has 1 survey, period.
4.  **Make Analysts Hope and Pray** by doing 2 different recipes, and hope the sampling overlap isn't too much.
